entry.title: Rivian - Tesla's Cybertruck, But Real | Up to Speed

media:group.media:title: Rivian - Tesla's Cybertruck, But Real | Up to Speed
media:group.media:description:
Thanks to Dr. Squatch for sponsoring today's video. Go to https://bit.ly/3ABSzoG and enter CODE: DSCDONUT at checkout to get 20% off orders $20 or more for new customers!
Illinois electric vehicle startup Rivian built the world’s first fully-electric production pickup, and car journalists can’t stop gushing about it. They also have a huge Amazon contract, and they’re worth more money than the Ford Motor Company. … HOW?! Who are these guys? Where did they come from? Do they actually have a chance at snatching Tesla’s EV crown? And what the crap is a lawn mower turn? Join host James Pumphrey to find out: What’s the deal with Rivian?!
To learn more about how green EVs really are, check out this episode of Wheelhouse: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G67i_Z8ukD4&t=533s
Thanks to Mike Schafernak for crushing this edit! Check out more of his stuff at: https://www.checkoutmikes.work

media:group.media:title: Why Your Brakes Can't Melt
media:group.media:description:
Thanks to Kove for sponsoring today’s video! Get 68% off or more for a limited time at http://koveaudio.com/donutbox when you use code DONUTBOX at checkout! (works sitewide)
There's a facinating science behind the materials that manufacturers choose for each brake pad. Today on B2B we'll learn the reasoning behind these choices, and learn about how these materials are engineered as we explore Wilwood's fabrication facility. We're about to show you why you should be getting as excited about your brakes as you are about that fancy new turbo you just spent your last paycheck on.
Learn more about what our friends at Wilwood do at https://www.wilwood.com/

entry.title: Paul Walker - Everything You Need to Know

media:group.media:title: Paul Walker - Everything You Need to Know
media:group.media:description:
Thanks to CarParts.com for sponsoring today’s episode. Click here https://bit.ly/CarPartscom3 to check out their massive inventory of car parts.
Paul Walker didn’t just play a laid back SoCal car guy in The Fast And The Furious movies, he was a laid back SoCal car guy IRL. The role of Brian O’Conner fit him like a glove, so it’s no wonder it became the defining role of his career. But there was more to Paul Walker than fast cars, explosive action, and cheesy lines—a lot more. Join host James Pumphrey as he gets you Up To Speed on the late, great Paul Walker!
For more info on Paul Walker's disaster relief non-profit, Reach Out Worldwide, click here: https://roww.org/
Shoutout to the Rybox 360-420 himself, Ryan Hailey for the edit. Check out his YouTube channel for more of his hilarious content: https://www.youtube.com/c/RyansShorts
Thanks to Megan Stump for the animations. Check out more of her work at: https://www.megantstump.com

entry.title: How Much F1 Crashes Actually Cost

media:group.media:title: How Much F1 Crashes Actually Cost
media:group.media:description:
Thanks to Omaze for sponsoring today’s video! For your chance to win a Mercedes-AMG GT Stealth Edition and support a great cause, enter at https://omaze.com/donut
Thanks to our friend Scott Mansell at Driver61 for sharing his time and knowledge for this episode. Subscribe to his channel at https://www.youtube.com/c/Driver61
Formula 1 wrecks like the one at Monza – where Verstappen did a burnout on Hamilton’s head – cost championship points and cold, hard cash. In 2021, those are both more precious than ever. When a big accident happens, that sends teams looking through their couches for change, but also wondering who should pick up the bill. So today, we’re gonna look at the high cost of F1 wrecks, figure out why they’re so expensive, and with special guest Scott Mansell of Driver 61, find out why they happen in the first place.
Thanks to the folks at Crashalong for letting us feature their animations. Check their channel out at https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtx6WmrMtv7CEyehbjnENxw
Curious about joining the Donut Underground? Hit that JOIN button on this video to learn how to become a member. If you're on iOS, the button might not be visible. We suggest opening this link in Safari or another browser: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCL6JmiMXKoXS6bpP1D3bk8g/join

entry.title: How Reality TV Saved F1 from Itself

media:group.media:title: How Reality TV Saved F1 from Itself
media:group.media:description:
Thanks to Keeps for sponsoring today’s video. Click here http://keeps.com/wheelhouse50 to get 50% off your first order of Keeps hair loss treatment.
Formula 1 is the world’s most popular motorsport, but just a few years ago it was on the brink of losing cultural relevancy. Then Drive to Survive happened. This is the story of how one show saved an entire sport.

entry.title: Lewis Hamilton Is The Greatest Athlete Of All Time | Up to Speed

media:group.media:title: Lewis Hamilton Is The Greatest Athlete Of All Time | Up to Speed
media:group.media:description:
Thanks to Current for sponsoring today’s video! Change your banking for the better by going to https://www.current.com/mediadonut
Can a Formula 1 driver really be the greatest athlete of all time? YES, and his name is Lewis Hamilton! But there’s more to that GOAT status than his astonishing SEVEN Championship wins. He’s a working class person of color in a sport long-dominated by rich white dudes, the first black F1 champ in history, and a just plain nice guy. Lewis Hamilton almost single-handedly saved Formula 1 from death by boredom. But how did he get to the top from such humble beginnings? Who helped him become the inspiration he is today? And did you know F1 drivers lose 9 POUNDS OF SWEAT during a race? Find out all this and more with host James Pumphrey as he gets you Up To Speed on The Greatest Athlete Of All Time, Lewis Hamilton!
Big ups to the one and only Zach Redpath for the edit. Zach was the throbbing visual soul of Donut for years, and he just busted out to explore the world. We ain’t mad about it. Godspeed, you beautiful maniac!
Thanks to Megan Stump and Raghav Arumugam for their fresh AF animations. Check out more of Megan’s work at: https://www.megantstump.com Peep Raghav’s YouTube channel for more hilarity: https://www.youtube.com/ragsanimations

entry.title: Giving Our Integra to a Subscriber… IF he can fix it

media:group.media:title: Giving Our Integra to a Subscriber… IF he can fix it
media:group.media:description:
We gave mechanic Andy two hours to fix this Acura Integra! If he could get it to start, he could KEEP IT. No strings attached.
We're trying something new with this video --this was a pilot episode for us. If you want to see more of these, make sure to hit the like button, and leave a comment letting us know what car you'd like to see us give away next, or how we could make this show better. As always, thank you for watching and your support. It's because of you guys that we can try new things like this.
Do you think you have what it takes? Want to be a contestant in the next episode and put your mechanic skills to the test? Make sure you're subscribed!

entry.title: How to Beat a Tesla Plaid for Cheap

media:group.media:title: How to Beat a Tesla Plaid for Cheap
media:group.media:description:
Thanks to Off The Record for sponsoring today’s video! Head on over to http://offtherecord.com/DONUT and use CODE: DONUT to get 10% off your first ticket
Big thanks to our friends at Road Test TV for our thumbnail image. Check out their channel! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNa6darq0bmZ6kLtsliiWiA
The Tesla Plaid is one of the fastest production EVs ever made and if you wanna beat it in an EV only race, you got two options: You could cheat on a technicality, or you could spend $2.4M dollars on a Rimac Nevera, the only production EV that’s faster. But what if there’s another way? A third option. Instead of buying a car to beat the Plaid, what if you built your own EV – and you did it on the cheap? Homemade EVs have been running faster 1/4-mile times than the Plaid for years, and many of those cost far less to build. So, there you go: the answer is “built not bought!” What’s the catch? Let’s find out!

entry.title: Why Good Car Names are RARE

media:group.media:title: Why Good Car Names are RARE
media:group.media:description:
Thanks to Omaze for sponsoring today’s video! For your chance to win a 2021 Ford Mustang Mach-E GT Performance and support a great cause, enter at https://omaze.com/mustangmache
Ford Mustang. Dodge Challenger. Toyota Tacoma. Some car names are so good, you can't imagine them being anything else. But sometimes, cars get dumb names. I'm talking REALLY dumb (Nissan Rouge anybody?). So how does that happen? We'll show you how cars get named, both good and bad.

entry.title: The Truth About Gran Turismo | Up to Speed

media:group.media:title: The Truth About Gran Turismo | Up to Speed
media:group.media:description:
Thanks to Atlas VPN for sponsoring today's video! Use promo code 'DONUTMEDIA' to get AtlasVPN for 86% OFF + 3 extra free months: https://atlasv.pn/DONUTMEDIA
When videogame developer Kazunori Yamauchi first pitched Gran Turismo, Sony said no. A few years later it became the best-selling title in the Playstation catalog, inspired followers like Forza, Dirt, and Project Car, and motivated genre giants like Mario Kart and Need For Speed to bring their A-game. How did this happen? What makes Gran Turismo so revolutionary? And what does the future hold for the world’s favorite racing game? Join host James Pumphrey as he finds out how Gran Turismo changed gaming forever.
High five to thee Ryan Hailey for the killer edit. Check out his YouTube channel for more of his hilarious content: https://www.youtube.com/c/RyansShorts
Thanks to Megan Stump for her fantastic animations. Check out https://www.megantstump.com for more of her work.
